reviews.text: Stopped off here on our canal holiday - it looked amazing from the outside, complete with it's own moorings. Once we got inside, menu / staff was all rather off-putting. For a sizeable place the place was virtually empty, except for a couple of young families with kids running amock, all of which seemed rather strange because the prices are certainly not to suit a young family.
reviews.title: Didn't appeal - inside didn't live up to the outside...
Fantastic facilities
reviews.text: Prices are quite expensive, but can't comment on quality and we quietly slipped out without having anything!

reviews.title: Very dissappointed in the food
reviews.text: The food in the waterside restaurant is very good and the facilities in the Country Club are fantastic. A lovely clean pool with a hot tub, sauna and steam room. Plenty of beds to lounge around on too.

Had the fish and chips which was around £11.00 per head. Tiny fish overcooked and chiops that resembled a small jenga game. Waited ages. Not the first time this has happened and won't be eating there again.
reviews.title: Mediocre.

reviews.text: Place was nice, staff serving were nice, food was okay but overpriced. It's a nice place but nothing of the wow factor. After spending more than £ 50 we were still hungryish! There are better places to spend £50.
reviews.title: An unexpected gem en-route up the A5!

reviews.text: We moored up here overnight while on a four day narrowboat cruise and decided to have a meal. The interior is very nice and service was good although quiet we had to ask when our drinks order would arrive. The food was nicely presented and of good quality although quiet pricey. It is obviously very popular as we left at about 8pm on a Sunday evening it was really getting quite busy. If on a narrowboat it is worth a visit if not for a meal maybe just a drink over the moorings which are provided free by the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice location and food

reviews.text: Five star service in a four star complex. 2 fantastic rooms with canalside balconies. Good, wholesome food and brilliant pool etc.
reviews.title: A wonderful, waterside break.

reviews.text: Looking forwards to another stay in September.
reviews.title: Very Dissappointing, ruining a Sunday

reviews.text: Had a really good feeling about going here after a wonderful spa break earlier in the year. We stopped for a family lunch at the restaurant, and although busy we were accommodated very quickly, 5 in total. Service was quick, orders taken and mains were ordered, no starters. When they arrived, the problems started. One goats cheese meal had less goats cheese than you would get as a taster in a supermarket at the deli counter. We mentioned this to the staff who removed it and returned it to the kitchen. It came back with the comment, "its the last piece". An alternative was offered of Salmon which was accepted. That arrived, minus the goats cheese only to look like it has come off another plate. Really disappointing and wont return. Many others looked like they were experiencing similar experiences. We have eaten there previously and it was delicious, but you only remember your last meal and I'm afraid it will be there. Stick to real pub/restaurants for good food. Waitresses we excellent, the issue was from the kitchens. On a plus, the puddings were nice, cheese board bland
reviews.title: Food excellent but staff training needed
Lion Quays Restaurant
reviews.text: The location is delightful, the food beautifully presented and cooked. Small but varied menu. However, the staff do need training in how to wait on table. Wine brought to the table and left for us to pour, no mention of tasting first. One of our party ordered a beer and was left with a bottle and glass - do it yourself??

reviews.title: Food poor - breakfast and dinner
reviews.text: No specials, meagre portions and unexciting choice, poorly cooked / overcooked. Pity as the staff are pleasant attentive and polite.

We stayed here for 1 night early last month. Beautiful setting, and location, our bedroom overlooked the Canal. Great views. The staff were all helpful and delightful. The food absolutely divine. We will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, fab hotel and restaurant, definitely recommend.

reviews.text: My sister and I had lunch at the restaurant - the main menu was varied & the light lunch menu of sandwiches with chips was good too. My sister had fish & chips which was beautifully cooked and large, I had pulled pork in barbecue sauce with melted cheese & gem lettuce on ciabatta with chips which was really nice. The service was good, the restaurant comfortable & right by the canal which would be nice in the summer. Not cheap but good.
reviews.title: Lovely food, great setting

reviews.text: Lovely Restaurant with top class food and service. Everyone enjoyed their meal very much. The service was good and staff very friendly.
reviews.title: TOP CLASS

reviews.text: We came late afternoon and had a meal from the main menu. Very nice meal with good service. Good location next to the canal. Very relaxing enjoyable time.
reviews.title: Nice afternoon meal
Breakfast & room
reviews.text: Plenty of variety, but some like the black pudding and scrambled egg was barely warm. No hot water for shower or bath, told by reception it was checked and working. Tried again, still only Luke warm

reviews.title: Nice restaurant food over priced..
reviews.text: Been here a few times now. The place is nice but it's never busy so you do feel a bit like you have the place to yourself. The food is good but in comparison to other places I think it is over priced so maybe this is why it's not so popular?
